imdb.title: Hachigatsu no Cinderella Nine
imdb.plot: When Arihara Tsubasa enters Rigahama Municipal High School and learns that it has no baseball club, she starts up the Girls' Baseball Club on her own. Drawn to the club are girls who have never played baseball before, girls who on...

episodes.title: Play Ball!
episodes.plot: On her very first day at Satogahama Municipal High School, Arihara Tsubasa steps onto the stage while the school's clubs are being introduced and declares, "The girls' hardball baseball team is looking for members!" Since it was originally a girls-only school, Satogahama doesn't even have a baseball team for boys. Tsubasa is scolded for making this declaration about a club that doesn't exist, but at her homeroom teacher's suggestion, she decides to start an association. Later, Nozaki Yuuki, a new student who can't decide which club to join, runs into Ukita Akane, who ...

episodes.title: Can or Can't
episodes.plot: To start a new association requires five members - but the main thing the girls need in order to play baseball is a place to practice. But there are no suitable locations at the school for playing baseball. Tsubasa and the others are worried, but they tell themselves that all they can do is start with whatever is possible right now. They start by visiting a baseball shop to buy equipment. As they're picking out gloves, they realize that Suzuki Waka, a classmate of Tsubasa and Yuuki's, is also at the shop.

episodes.title: Let's Work Up a Good Sweat
episodes.plot: With a field, an advisor, and five members, the girls' baseball association is officially in action. They finally begin to practice using the training regimens devised by Waka - and as they do, second-year student Iwaki Yoshimi of Satogahama's cheer squad pays them a visit. Then another second-year, Asada Aoi, also shows up, and the two of them end up becoming members of the association. The girls are thrilled to add two unique new members to their ranks, And what's more, Nakano Ayaka of the newspaper club shows up, as well.

episodes.title: Though We May Stand at a Crossroads
episodes.plot: The semifinal round of last year's Senior Little League tournament came down to Fujiura High versus Kuramoto Chuo High. Recalling that game is vexing for Ryou, but to Tsubasa, it's a precious memory. Tsubasa opens up to the other members about why she decided to start a girls' baseball team at Satogahama instead of joining a club team. One year ago, Tsubasa was facing the decision of whether to keep playing baseball or quit.

episodes.title: Our First Game!
episodes.plot: The team sets its lineup, acquires new uniforms, and organizes a practice game with Seijo High School, led by Sayaka Jinguj.

episodes.title: What We Do From Now On
episodes.plot: Struggling with her skills, Tomoe practices on her own at a shrine until she encounters Jinguji, who agrees to train with her.

episodes.title: The Smiling Lost Child
episodes.plot: With the team running low on funds to maintain their equipment, the girls decide to get part-time jobs and request the student council to promote it from association to club status. The council's sports supervisor Kana Tsukumo attends and participates in a practice, while Yuki invites Maiko Kurashiki, a classmate from elementary school, to try out.

episodes.title: Looking Ahead to Summer
episodes.plot: The club decides to play in a summer tournament, but their advisor, who also oversees the kendo club, fails to convince faculty to provide additional funding to pay for the trip. In response, the team launches a petition that gains support from the other students.

episodes.title: Having Each Others' Backs, and Having Fun
episodes.plot: After hearing Seijo High is hosting a training camp, Satogahama decides to do the same at the shrine, overseen by the baseball-loving head priest.

episodes.title: Wings on Your Back
episodes.plot: With two weeks until the tournament, the team arranges a scrimmage against Kogetsu High School, who had reached the nationals the previous year.

episodes.title: The National Tournament Begins
episodes.plot: To open the tournament, Satogahama is scheduled to play a rematch with Seijo High. On their trip, the two teams encounter each other at their rest stop.

episodes.title: The Hottest Summer Ever
episodes.plot: While conversing with her teammates, Jinguji is urged by her catcher to not carry too much of the team's burden herself and allow her teammates to contribute. Inspired, Seijo begins to mount a comeback.

episodes.title: The Story Continues
episodes.plot: Special episode of Cinderella Nine, featuring new characters.
